nmax = sample(5:8,1)
nterms = 4
cf = sample(2:9,nterms,T)*sample(c(-1,1),nterms,T)
dg = nmax:(nmax-4+1)
mkp = function(cf,dg){
    f = paste0("{",cf,"}x^{",dg,"}",collapse="+")
    f = gsub("+{-","-{",f,fixed=T)
    f = gsub("x^{1}","x",f,fixed=T)
    f = gsub("x^{0}","",f,fixed=T)
    f = gsub("x^{0}","",f,fixed=T)
    f = gsub("{","",f,fixed=T)
    f = gsub("}","",f,fixed=T)
    return(f)
}
m1 = rep(-1,nterms) #-f(x)
if(nmax%%2==1){
    m2 = rep(c(-1,1),nterms)[1:nterms] #f(-x)
    m3 = rep(c(1,-1),nterms)[1:nterms] #-f(-x)
} else {
    m2 = rep(c(1,-1),nterms)[1:nterms] #f(-x)
    m3 = rep(c(-1,1),nterms)[1:nterms] #-f(-x)
}
f = mkp(cf,dg)
nf = mkp(cf*m1,dg)
fn = mkp(cf*m2,dg)
nfn = mkp(cf*m3,dg)
ex1 = gsub("x","(-x)",f,fixed=T)
ex2 = paste0("-\\left(",ex1,"\\right)",collapse="")
ex3 = paste0("-\\left(",fn,"\\right)",collapse="")

ach = sample(c(f,nf,fn,nfn))
al = paste0("* $",ach,"$",collapse="\n")

sol = paste0(1*(ach==nfn),collapse="")

Solution
========

Write the given expression.

$$`r ex2`$$

Get rid of inner parentheses. An odd amount of negative factors results in a negative product. An even amount of negative factors results in a positive product.

$$`r ex3`$$

Distribute the outer negative to all terms.
